column4: OK everybody, I have a new problem with my Live CD; when I reconfigured my BIOS to run the CD first and the HDD LAST, it starts up with this message: Non-system disk, press any key..._
dirty disk?
i don't think so
did you md5 it?
what do you mean, md5 it?
the ISO image, did you run a checksum?
or is it a CD you had delivered?
It's a CD i burned myself after downloading the 6.06 ISO
did you run a checksum on the ISO then?
I have no idea what thatis
it checks your dload isn't corrupt
I had no problem with the download when I got it...
yeah but it might be wrong, if it's saying it's not a system disk that means it's not got the right data on it
I extracted it right from the ISO with WinRAR and burned it to a CD
should I try version 7?
there's your problem -_- use something like NERO to burn it using the ISO
I used the standard Windows burning wizard
you said you extracted it
you shouldn't have
right, extracted the data and burned it to a CD
you're not supposed to do it like that, you're supposed to put the ISO directly ON the cd
using a burning prog that can "burn from image"
but when I insert the Live CD while the computer's already running, it works perfectly
it's not burnt the boot code it's only burnt the files
